traffic cones.description: Traffic cones are lined up on the left side of the road, forming a line.
traffic cones.explanation: This setup likely means that there is road construction ahead or a lane closure, necessitating a slowdown and possibly a merge to the left.

barriers.description: A white barrier appears, extending ahead on the road.
barriers.explanation: These barriers are diverting traffic away from specific areas of the road, likely due to road construction or building sites, which have reduced the road width, necessitating cautious driving.

general_perception.description and explanation: The traffic image shows that traffic cones are lined up on the left side of the road, forming a line. This setup likely indicates that there is road construction ahead or a lane closure, necessitating a slowdown and possibly a merge to the left. Additionally, a white barrier extends ahead on the road. These barriers are diverting traffic away from specific areas of the road, likely due to road construction or building sites, which have reduced the road width, necessitating cautious driving.

driving_suggestion: Your vehicle should comply with the requirements of traffic signs. Drive carefully, maintain a safe speed appropriate for the current conditions, and be prepared to merge left when necessary in response to indicated road construction. It is recommended to continuously monitor the road for additional instructions or changes in road conditions. Pay attention to any supplementary signs or signals that may provide further instructions, and be ready at all times to respond to changes in road conditions or the sudden actions of road workers. Due to the travel path being narrowed by cones and obstacles, your vehicle should also be mindful to maintain a safe distance from these objects.

1.description and explanation: A vertical, fluorescent striped traffic cone with a reflective band around the top, typically used as a safety signal to mark hazardous or off-limits areas, indicating repair or construction work ahead. Ego car must slow down and potentially change lanes to avoid the cone while maintaining a safe distance from the work zone.

2.description and explanation: A barrier that demarcates a construction or maintenance area. It suggests that a portion of the roadway ahead may be closed or restricted, prompting the ego car to adhere to lane changes or restrictions.

3.description and explanation: A traffic cone is positioned on the side of the road with high visibility stripes. These cones are typically used to indicate areas where drivers should be cautious or to denote areas of road work or potential hazards. In future driving behavior, the presence of a traffic cone may require the driver of the ego car to reduce speed and be prepared for unexpected obstructions or changes in road conditions.
